_header: Those other three parts which in the book
Note: Verse prologue to prose lesson and reflections on All Saints’ Day, part of Hoccleve’s Series, occurring after the prose moralitas to 4879 — 3 stanzas rhyme royal.

Bod221.First Lines:
Thoo other thre partis which in þe boke
                    Of þe tretice of deth expressid be
                    …
Bod221.Last Lines:
…That for to comprehende þat gladnesse
                    Verreyly ne wit may ne tunge expresse
Bod221.Attributed Title: Here endith to lerne to dye and begynneth a prolog of þe ix lesson þat is red on all halow day (f. 42v); Here endith þe prolog and begynnyth þe lesson (f. 42v)

BodLauMis735.First Lines:
TO other thre parties which in þe booke
                    Off þe tretice of deth expressid be
                    …
BodLauMis735.Last Lines:
…That for to comprehende þat gladnesse
                    Verrili not wit may ne tung expresse
BodLauMis735.Note: First two lines of the prose work that follows at the bottom of f. 41 are written as verse with verse markers, the prose happening to end both lines with “is.”
BodLauMis735.Attributed Title: Here endith to lerne to dye and begynnyth a prolog of þe ix lesson þat is red on all halow day (f. 41); Here endith þe prologue and begynnyth þe lesson (f. 41)

CovAcc3251.First Lines:
Thoo othir three partes which in þe bokeOf the tretice of
                    deþe expressid be…
CovAcc3251.Last Lines:
…That for to comprehende that gladnesseVerailie noo wight may
                    ne tonge expresse
CovAcc3251.Attributed Title:
Here beginnith the prologe of the Ixe lesson on all hallowen
                    daie (f. 63vb)

BLRoy17Dvi.First Lines: The other thre partes which in the bookeOf the tretice of deth expressed be…
BLRoy17Dvi.Last Lines: …That forto comprehend that gladnesseVerraily no wight may ne tonge expresse
